title: ¿Es posible desactivar la función de "decisiones de autenticación"?
content:
Desde Firefox 81, por defecto cuando se accede a un sitio web que requiere autenticación mediante certificado digital, esa "decisión de autenticación" se guarda entre sesiones. Es decir, si cierras Firefox y accedes nuevamente al mismo sitio web, ya no te pedirá elegir el certificado, sino que automáticamente lo selecciona y accedes de forma transparente.

Ésta función, que a priori puede resultar interesante, se convierte en un auténtico dolor de cabeza cuando se trabaja habitualmente con varios certificados digitales diferentes. Incluso, resulta que la opción de recordar decisión de autenticación viene activada por defecto en la ventana de selección de certificado y desmarcarla provoca infinidad de peticiones de selección de certificado en cada sitio web al que trates de entrar. También resulta bastante engorroso llegar al listado de decisiones de autenticación guardadas para poder eliminarlas y forzar nuevamente la selección de certificado.

En resumen, mi preguntas es... ¿existe alguna manera de desactivar ésta función? ¿Quizás alguna opción en about:config?.
creator: ZeuGiRDoR

title: Problems with login (Wordpress installation)
content:
Hello,

The login of my client's website has stopped working with firefox. We are using WordPress, we don't have any problems in the past, but now suddenly it stops working with Firefox.

Trying to debug the problem, I figured out it's something related to cookies. If you try in incognito mode, it just works fine, and you can log in/out as many times as you want and it just works. I was trying to delete cookies too, and sometimes it logs in again, but when I log out, I cannot log in back in.

I'm also seeing other threads in the forum of people having problems logging in to different websites, so I guess is all related. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1325386 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1325376

Thanks,

title: Not working the same as Edge - Almost didn't get a Vaccine!!!
content:
Publix in Florida is distributing Covid vaccines using this website: https://www.publix.com/covid-vaccine/booknow

The site refreshes every minute and it is suggested you not manually refresh. If there are appointments available, it changes to display a couple of buttons "Wait" and "Book Now".

Microsoft Edge displays the buttons on the time that they advertise appointments will be available. Firefox does NOT change - it seems to ignore the auto-refresh. You have to stop it (kill it completely) and restart.

I had been relying on Firefox and never got through. Being old, I started an Edge window as backup - just in case - and got my Appointment using EDGE.

This problem almost cost me a VACCINE APPOINTMENT!!!!

creator: guillaume.souchay

title: Marcos
content: Descargue Mozilla para mi computadora, la instalación termino bien y sin interrupciones pero, a la hora de abrir el software todo el navegador me aparece con símbolos y no con letras. (anexo imagen) ya pobre entrando en modo seguro como lo mencionan en otro comentario, y restableciendo el navegador, pero continua el detalle visual.
creator: nino0bomb4

title: Opening external links in current browser window
content: I use Firefox for personal/school, and Nightly for work. Apps like Zoom and WhatsApp I use for everything. Is there a way to make links clicked in these or other external apps open in the browser I'm currently using? As of now everything opens in Firefox, which is distracting and flow-breaking if I'm working in Nightly. This may be because Firefox is my 'default profile'? I'd be happy to not have a default and whichever one I'm using is the go-to for links, etc. I recently (and happily!) switched from Chrome, which actually handled this scenario optimally. Thanks for any advice.
creator: joshuagenuth

title: Forget About This Site function is worst UX I have ever come across.
content:
When I press CTRL + H I am in a history tab, right?

Therefore I am under the impression that I am working with my history, AND NOTHING ELSE.

Because I can't shift multi-select history items to delete a lot at once (also bad UX), I see the option to "Forget About This Site".

Aha, I think, that will help remove unnecessary clutter, so I can see a bunch of websites that I need for a project I am working on.

I have now discovered that the "Forget About This Site" also DELETES PASSWORDS OF THE SITE WITHOUT TELLING ME IT IS GOING TO DO SO.

This is infinitely beyond Microsoft levels of UX disconnect from human thinking.

The person who came up with this functionality needs to be banned from ever working in UX or programming for humans ever again.

I have lost countless passwords to countless sites merely because I wanted to quickly remove bunches of sites from my history.

Keep modes of UX separate! History tab is for editing history. Password tab is for editing passwords. It's not rocket science. Don't add functionality for the sake of it. If the function will delete something as important as a password to a website, maybe, just maybe, GIVE A WARNING IN BIG BRIGHT BOLD LETTERS.
creator: CrankyFFUser

title: Captchas always appear on google form submission using FireFox.

When I use Chrome the Google Form submit without any Captchas verifcation. FYI, I reset by clearing "EverThing" on Firefox before filling the Google Form but the Captchas will appear.

Can someone give me some guidance on the work around. Thanks

title: Getting Tired of Firefox Crashing
content: Not sure if it is completely Firefox or Fox News, but have had trouble with Firefox and random shutting down or closing of tabs... been for the last several versions... should fix these problems before going to new versions... all this moving ahead while leaving past versions broken doesn't improve PR... been Firefox users since their beginning almost... however, it is difficult to find any browser that's any better, which is really sad... modern technology, not always for the better. Anything that works to stop tabs closing or the browser shutting down?
creator: sle727

title: How to Undo Firefox Refresh
content: So recently my Firefox crashed (as it does sometimes when I sort my bookmarks) and I accidentally clicked refresh Firefox, thinking that it would just refresh everything like a restart does. Instead, it deleted everything - my logins, my cookies, my extensions - and I don't know how to get it back. I tried looking online for the answers, but none of the solutions I found worked (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1195682 was the closest one that had some semblance of sanity) and the closest I figured was that I needed to either create a new profile with different settings I could import from my Old Firefox Data or put the Old Firefox Data in the Profiles folder which doesn't seem to be working, as there are always two other folders within. I tried creating new profiles with the Old Firefox Data as the basis, yet it doesn't work. In addition, I like my old profile and don't exactly want to switch, although if that is the cost of retrieving my data, I will take it. Any solutions please? I rely on my computer quite often, and I don't want to be handicapped for a while. My computer is also the recent updated Mac version, if that helps.
creator: amylastlast123

title: Cache set to be cleared upon closing the browser and does not.
content: After closing all Firefox browsers, with the setting to clear all cache upon closing the browser in place, I can close all browsers down, reboot the computer, or not, and open up another Firefox browser with nothing for a homepage but a search bar and the Firefox logo, and might have 6 or more megs in cache. This is messed up.
creator: creiner199

title: bookmark management
content:
Hi. Sorry FF folks, but bookmark management in the new ff is still a disaster.

Bookmark management failures to be corrected asap: 1. it does not properly delete and create new bookmarks 2. you cannot search by folder name, only bookmark name 3. there is no feature 'show in folder' like the old extension 'go parent folder' (which is key to any proper bookmark management)

4. many more intelligent features are missing, but start with the above and you get am actually useful browser (many still use the old ff for bookmark management, since nothing compares)

5. make bookmarks, cookies, history and any user customizations or content completely inaccessible by any site as it is horrible to learn that sites could read all those and much more for many years (who ever had such a bad, evil and abusive idea)

Please stop any ignorance/superficiality, as they are not solutions, but problems! The old ff was great, the new ff is...well, not new anymore...so it really needs the above done/fixed.

Thx!

)
